Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate the characteristics of ice before heating.
The student can depict the process of heating that causes ice to melt into water.
The student can show the characteristics of water after the ice has melted.
The student can draw the process of cooling that turns water back into ice.
The student can demonstrate the characteristics of ice after water has been cooled and frozen again.
The student can symbolize the idea that the change from ice to water and back to ice is a reversible change.
The student can use their drawing to support the claim that some changes caused by heating or cooling can be reversed.
